comment.author: 8543109@N02
comment._content: May be the former Undersecretary of the Interior (about 1913) who later became US Senator from New Mexico (who sponsored a bill to establish a park which seems to have later become Bandelier), and chairman of the Senate's Woman Suffrage Committee. (A date of 7/15/13 is visible in reverse in the upper left corner)

comment.author: 70251312@N00
comment._content: The First Assistant Secretary of the Interior: 1913-16.

comment.author: 33593953@N02
comment._content: Thanks for supplying fuller identification and spotting the date on the negative. It appears that the New Mexico Historical Society has the same photo, and it was used in the Biographical Directory of the United States Congress, where a brief biographical entry and pointers to related resources are also available: http://bioguide.congress.gov/scripts/biodisplay.pl?index=J000210. We'll add information to the description when we update it.
